summary: I have more than 19 years of multi-cultural experience in the Government, Industry, and International Organizational environment.  I am Highly motivated, result oriented and experienced Chemist and  Project Manager with a demonstrated history of working at OPCW (Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons, The Hague, Netherlands( 2012-2019) which won the Nobel Peace Prize of 2013; and at Ministry of Industry of Ethiopia, Addis Ababa ( 2000-2012). My professional history includes positions such as Evaluation Officer  at Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)  and  Director of Chemical  and related Industry Development in Ministry of Industry of Ethiopia, and Head of National Authority of Ethiopia for the implementation of the  Chemical Weapons Convention. Furthermore, I have considerable experience  in areas of project and programme management; Sound Management of Chemicals and Waste. Chemical Safety and Security; implementation of the Chemical Weapons Convention (CWC) ; monitoring, validation, evaluation and analysis of data and information related to chemical production and  chemical trade; development of training materials and tools; Organizing and conducting  capacity building programs, training, seminars and workshops; Coordination of events at  national and international level, Risk Assessment, Report Writing, Presentations; Strategy and guideline development related to Chemical safety and waste management in chemical, cement and leather industry sectors. I have considerable experience working with governments, private sector institutions and stakeholders  at national and global level . I believe I have  excellent  communication, negotiation, analytical and problem-solving skills , with proven experience in conveying ideas, and building sound relationships to positively engage key partners and stakeholders.

profile_positions.company: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
profile_positions.description:
I Validated, evaluated, analyzed and interpreted declarations (chemical production facilities,  chemical production, import, export and consumption ) received from States Parties and produced comprehensive official report of OPCW on declarations. And maintained the confidentiality of the information. 
Conducted follow-up with States Parties to the Convention to ensure timely submission of annual declarations and resolution of outstanding issues pertinent to implementation of the provisions of the Convention
Initiated, planed and  coordinated capacity building programs, outreach activities; developed and updated training materials, and online modules ;  delivered presentations on topics  pertaining to the provisions of the Chemical Weapons Convention, such as Declaration requirements under CWC, identification of  toxic chemicals and their precursors; Technical Aspects of the Transfers Regime of the Chemical Weapons Convention;  and preparation and submission annual declarations in accordance with the provision of the convention. 
Reviewed, monitored and evaluated activities relating to the implementation of Article VI of the Chemical Weapons Convention including implementation of Executive Council (EC) and Conference of States Parties (CSP) decisions and recommendations on the provisions of CWC. Prepared and contributed to regular reports and inputs for the sessions of the Executive Council and the Conference of States Parties.
Contributed to the development and update of  OPCW chemical databases and tools with information on chemicals related to the CWC
Contributed to the preparation of the classified and unclassified versions of the annual Verification Information Report (VIR) in line with the Policy-Making Organs' requirements. 
Contributed to the Achievements of the OPCW and the 2013 Nobel Prize for Peace awarded to the OPCW for its extensive efforts to eliminate chemical weapons.
